title: Kalista is the single most frustrating thing to fight against
body:
Especially if you're melee. I would rather fight 5 {{champion:26}}'s over a single {{champion:429}}. If you are melee, and don't have point and click **hard** CC, you're pretty much screwed. Doesn't help that Riot is phasing out point and click CC (so basically buffing her). I imagine a few years or whenever {{champion:80}} gets updated they'll remove his stun, and thus making him unable to catch her. Seriously, it has been months and she has not received a single _meaningful_ nerf. She still gets up to 2.5 bullshit dashes a second, although realistically, she gets probably around 1.5 or 2, it's still retarded.

Why? _Seriously? Why?_ _**WHY?!?**_ Not to mention they just kinda said fuck it and gave her a slow, and an ability to force her support to come save her, giving her a knock up. She has more CC than most ADC's, one of which is hard, although reliant on an ally. She has %HP damage because "you need your support to also auto attack." Oh man, enemy {{champion:20}} and {{champion:31}} both with smite are coming to take baron while your team is doing it? Don't worry, you can press E and do 3k damage. Because fuck you.

Is there seriously a single person in this entire community that thinks Kalista is 100% well rounded. Because your only counter being point and click CC (which again, Riot is phasing out), is pretty dumb.

replies.body: Problem with kalista is that she isnt op, and in lane she can get pooped on by other adcs. However, she is one of the most broken champions in the game in my opinion. She doesnt have an amazing win rate, but she is a champion whose kit is fundamentally broken without a doubt. Out damaging any jungler with smite on dragon/baron, constant dashes, free waveclear (that refunds mana cost too...), free thresh lantern for support (seriously why is this here), free wards, and much more bs.

>and in lane she can get pooped on by other adcs. 

she doesn't,that's just the bad ones,she actually has a very strong,very safe laning phase.

BUT ANYWAY,kalista is very much op as you NEED point click cc(or burst) to deal with her,meaning a very small set of champions(who riot considered to lack counterplay,but can't realize their beloved cancershitsta is far worse ) is needed vs her else she gets completely out of control,she hard counters a huge pool of champions,which is a very big strength,but what is her tradeoff for it?

Remember carry junglers before cinderhulk? who forced mobility in all lanes and the ability to withstand their pressure from all junglers? Some would say they were balanced(or at least some of them were),but no,the entire role("carry jungler") was broken,it countered half of the champion pool and payed nothing for it,so we just didn't see said half of the champion pool.

If there's one thing to learn from cinderhulk is that countering a large number of champions has to come with a tradeoff and is very much op if it doesn't,sure the meta will "adapt" and you just won't see the champions countered by it,but that doesn't make it balanced.

p.s: I wonder why support nautilus is so popular right now,could it be because he has point click cc?

By the power of the self-confirming bias, I've gotten myself to a point where I trust unfamiliar Kalistas about as much as I do unfamiliar Vaynes, which is unfortunate. I think Kalista was founded on a really cool concept of co-dependence, and I would love to see that work out, but I have a very hard time liking a champ who so often makes my lane feel like a 1v3.

May I ask how you work with Kalista, both in terms of game mechanics and communicating with the player? For context, I usually take Leona or Taric into a Kalista, but sometimes wind up as Soraka, Zyra, or Nami if I can't respond to their pick for whatever reason.

I feel your pain, lol.  It can be hit or miss with any champ and you just never really know what's going to happen.  Sometimes you just have to trust, but a quick stats check on League's Match History or LOLNexus can either quell my worries or encourage my dodge, but I make it a point to chat quite a bit in the pre-game just to get everyone on the same page.  

Especially when I'm support, I'm constantly chatting and pinging.  Since my role is much less mechanically intensive, I can pay more attention to map objectives and our opponent's strengths and weaknesses.  The vast majority of my games as a support, I feel like a coach.  Worst case scenario you tell your team what they already know, best case scenario you avoid serious casualties.  No harm in speaking your mind as long as you are approaching the team properly.  

I like to say "we need this" or "if this, then this" type of chat instead of direct commands because I think it's more constructive.  _"We need to watch that Talon's roam, we can't let him get any bigger."  "We need everyone to upgrade their trinkets, they're roaming really well and bot-lane can't respond to the pressure."_  If anyone else follows through with your "requests", thank them or tell them good job.  It's kind of amazing what can happen as long as someone stays positive, gives constructive input and can follow that up with good plays.  

As far as working with Kalista goes, I think laying down some guidelines at the beginning of the match can work wonders.  Those guidelines are all pretty circumstantial, so it's up to you to determine what your needs are in response to the enemy team.  For instance, I like to play Soraka support and even though Soraka doesn't carry an extra cheesy engage like an Alistar or a Sion, that get out of jail free card for Soraka can be game-changing.  It's okay if you aren't the "ideal" support for Kali, her kit is so universal anything can work.  

I don't want my Kali to use me as an engage, but I would be okay with a re-engage under the right circumstances.  So I tell them, but I make sure they know our number one priority is keeping me safe, not putting me in danger so she can't be upset if she picks me up expecting a Raka dive only to see me fly out in the opposite direction.  Since I'll be playing pretty far back, I might also tell Kali not to worry about ranking her W up since I'll rarely be close enough to make use of it.  If you want vision in a particular area, but don't have a ward, ask for a Sentinal.  Kali's Sentinels are a godsend, but most players don't have the presence of mind to use them properly, that's where you come in.  They're great for covering area early on when trinket wards are down.  For instance, if you and Kali are pushed into your tower, ask her to send a Sentinel through the bot-lane brush so you know the enemy jungler didn't sneak in when you didn't have vision.
